description:
High Resolution Version (click to expand)

SALTMAP (rare map, it is not safe to navigate with this map)

Cartography of the Saltkek ??Kingdom. 

References: 
1. Saltkek ??Castle 
2. Danktown in the south (threatened by Bobos) 
3. Fakecity in the north 
4. KEK Ranges CP Rabbit Hole 
5. Snowy Salt Forest 
6. Pure salt crystals 
7. The Opensea Monster 
8. Bobotown 
9. Bluebears Mountain
------ 
Chapter II
 
A dense bluish mist covers the outskirts of the Kingdom of Salt. Until recently we knew nothing about its nature. We were too busy hunting down the Bobos that were spreading across the south of the kingdom, rampaging through the salt mines and farms of Bitcorn.
33 Knights have sweated blood to keep the Bobos at bay. Some commoners have taken up their work tools and now dispute every inch of their farms with the Bobos.
Among them has appeared the mysterious Ser Power “Sweeper of Bobos” who has massacred and hung dozens of Bobos from the walls with no more help than a broom. The damsels have taken courage and they themselves have dressed the armor of their ancestors and given fight to the Bobos with their brooms.
The First Knight has led numerous victories on the battlefield. He has shown that the collective spirit of Pepes is unstoppable. A legend grows around him; it is said that he eats the hearts of every captured Bobo and thus the First Knight becomes more and more powerful.
The Knight and Captain have sailed the angry waves of the Opensea to bring the skeletons of Pepes who vacationed on the shores to the kingdom's laboratories. They have been given a glorious burial and their greatest fears have been proven: the blue mist comes from a new breed of Bobos. It is believed to be their breath after these beasts devour piles of salt. The elders spoke of this in the scriptures, warning that blue breath can drive the most honorable Pepes mad. While the Knights continue to congregate in the main cities of the continent, an expeditious group has donned the best memes in the region and has gone in search of the Great Wizards to decipher the nature of the blue beasts and find a way to end with them.
name: SALTMAP
